summary: The Fair and Accountable IRS Reviews Act (H.R. 5346) aims to reform the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding penalty and interest provisions. Specifically, it mandates that the initial determination of a penalty assessment must be personally approved in writing by the immediate supervisor (or a higher official designated by the Secretary). The bill defines "immediate supervisor" and sets an effective date for the amendments as after December 31, 2025.
